always_present.title: Introduction / Overview
always_present.purpose: Briefly explain what the project is, what it does, and who it is for so readers can quickly understand its purpose.

always_present.title: Installation / Setup
always_present.purpose: Describe prerequisites and how to install or set up the project locally or on a server.

always_present.title: Quick Start / Basic Usage
always_present.purpose: Provide a minimal, copy‑pasteable set of steps or commands that let users run or try the project as fast as possible.

always_present.title: Features
always_present.purpose: Summarize the key capabilities and selling points of the project at a glance.

always_present.title: License
always_present.purpose: State the licensing terms and link to the license file so users know how they can use, modify, and distribute the project.

very_common.title: Configuration
very_common.purpose: Explain configurable options (files, environment variables, flags) and how to customize the behavior of the project.

very_common.title: Advanced Usage / Commands / API
very_common.purpose: Document more detailed usage scenarios, CLI commands, APIs, or power‑user workflows beyond the basic quick start.

very_common.title: Architecture / Project Structure
very_common.purpose: Describe how the code or system is organized (modules, directories, components) and any important design decisions.

very_common.title: Documentation / Resources
very_common.purpose: Link to or summarize broader documentation, guides, or external resources for deeper learning.

very_common.title: Requirements / Prerequisites
very_common.purpose: List system requirements, dependencies, and any accounts, hardware, or services needed before installation.

very_common.title: Troubleshooting / FAQ
very_common.purpose: Cover common issues, error messages, and frequently asked questions with their solutions or workarounds.

very_common.title: Security / Privacy / Ethics
very_common.purpose: Call out security considerations, privacy implications, safe‑use guidelines, or ethical constraints where relevant.

very_common.title: Contributing
very_common.purpose: Explain how others can contribute (bug reports, feature requests, pull requests) and outline contribution guidelines.

very_common.title: Support / Community / Contact
very_common.purpose: Tell users how to get help, join communities (Discord, forums), or contact the maintainers.

very_common.title: Acknowledgments / Credits
very_common.purpose: Recognize people, projects, institutions, or tools that inspired or supported this project.

optional.title: Table of Contents
optional.purpose: Provide a navigable list of sections in the README to help readers quickly find what they need, especially for long documents.

optional.title: Motivation / Why This Project?
optional.purpose: Explain the problem being solved, the context, and why the project exists compared to alternatives.

optional.title: Demo / Examples / Screenshots
optional.purpose: Showcase the project in action with commands, sample outputs, screenshots, or live demo links.

optional.title: Performance / Benchmarks
optional.purpose: Present metrics, comparisons, or scalability data demonstrating how the project performs.

optional.title: Roadmap / TODO / Future Work
optional.purpose: Outline planned features, improvements, or milestones so users and contributors know where the project is heading.

optional.title: Use Cases / Example Workflows
optional.purpose: Describe typical scenarios, workflows, or real‑world applications where the project is useful.

optional.title: Project Status / Limitations
optional.purpose: Indicate stability, maturity, known limitations, and any experimental or WIP areas.

optional.title: Testing / CI
optional.purpose: Explain how to run tests, what test suites exist, and any continuous integration setup.

optional.title: Deployment
optional.purpose: Describe how to deploy the project to production or cloud environments and any deployment‑specific settings.

optional.title: Citation / Publications
optional.purpose: Provide citation information, DOIs, or links to papers for academic or research‑oriented projects.

optional.title: Changelog / Release Notes / Star History
optional.purpose: Summarize notable changes over time, version history, or project growth indicators.
